byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, and Nicola Clark from Paris. Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Düsseldorf, Germany, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.
byline.original: By JACK EWING and NICOLA CLARK

abstract: German airline Lufthansa faces mounting scrutiny over crash of one of its Germanwings planes in French alps, particularly in regard to airline's admission that it was aware co-pilot Andreas Lubitz had undergone period of severe depression.
lead_paragraph: The airline instead faced perhaps the worst crisis in its history, as anger in Germany was increasingly directed toward the company and its chief executive.

headline.main: Lufthansa Faces Mounting Challenges as More Details of Germanwings Crash Emerge
headline.print_headline: Lufthansa Faces Mounting Challenges as More Details of Alps Crash Emerge

snippet: The airline instead faced perhaps the worst crisis in its history, as anger in Germany was increasingly directed toward the company and its chief executive.
